Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for location.”
Reviews.Author: tolga7t
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in order to go to Universal Studios early in the morning. Well, I was suprised to find such an inexpensive room in a such an important location and the rooms had all I needed, so definitely 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay again”
Reviews.Author: kerrie g
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at several comfort Inns while travelling around California, most were excellent except this one. The staff behind the desk were rude, we were travelling with our 2 sons and one of the reasons we stayed at Comfort Inns were the laundry facility's, which the brochure in the room claimed to have a laundry on every floor. When I couldnt locate the laundry I was told very rudely that it was an old brochure. The room was comfortable but the bathroom had more mold than I could tolerate, the room next door had the TV going loudly the entire night making sleep difficult. We booked for 4 nights but left after 3 nights. Will never stay at this particular Comfort Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons I booked this Comfort Inn is because of the wonderful service I had at the Comfort Inn in Oakland. Maybe these people need to talk to Oakland. We went to breakfast at 9:10 and were told we couldn't get anything to eat. I talked to the manager and showed him the flyer in the room saying breakfast went until 9:30 (their flyer) and he said it was an old form and the breakfast ended at 9:00. I said I based my coming down to breakfast according to their information and booked the Inn because they served breakfast. While bickering with him, the woman cleaning up the breakfast area let someone else in to grab a few pre-packaged pastries. They did let us eat a few of the breakfast items. I will say, if you are white, you won't be treated as nicely as if you are not. The front desk people weren't very friendly either.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: stevereviews
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of 4 and 5 star hotels in Los Angeles that offer impecable service and amenities that are as good as you'll find anywhere outside of Asia. But when it comes to finding an affordable hotel in a good location for under $100, that's a different story. There are a lot of scary places and hotels way off the beaten path. And what may only look like a 15 or 20 minute car trip on the map can often turn into a 2-hour nightmare on LA's infamous roads. That's why I have chosen to stay at the Comfort Inn whenever I want to take a few days in Los Angeles beyond what work will pay for. (I actually get to stay in many of the city's finest hotels for work but I'm not about to spend $300-$400 on my own nickel!) The Comfort Inn is literally right next door to the city's Metro station that's just a few quick stops from Hollywood and the Kodak Theater. IF you don't mind a long trip, you can also take the train(s) to LAX, but it's at least a 1.5-2 hour journey. It's also on several major buslines, including the Beverly bus that goes all the way through Beverly Hills and connects to busses that'll easily take you to Santa Monica and the ocean. But what really keeps me coming back is the service and staff. Peter the manager is a great guy and his team are all efficient and courteous. They also offer FREE internet and a breakfast that includes eggs, sausage, waffles, toast, fruit, cereal and yogurt. The great irony is that the breakfast and internet would cost you an additional $30 or $40 bucks at least at the hotels that charge $300 and up a night! Finally, the rooms are very clean with a flat screen tv, and a really nice shower with a massaging feature, a refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave right in the room. Don't be concerned when you arrive - the street and outside could concern some people who haven't stayed in Urban hotels. But once you get in the lobby and are greeted by the staff, the experience will be a very good one.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel with good metro red line connection”
Reviews.Author: Si_uk_says
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first part of out trip for 5 nights. We took the LAX Flyaway to Union Station $7 and then the Metro Line red ($5 day pass, $20 for 7 days) to Vermont/Beverly Station. The Hotel is one building away to the left from the Metro station. We were greeted but a pleasant guy on reception and quickly checked in. The reception area looked clean and modern, we then took the lift (elevator) to the 2nd floor, the lift did not look as modern and looked like it could do with some TLC. The hallways in the hotel looked in a good state if a little dated, the doors to the rooms could do with a fresh paint job though. The room was large with two double comfy beds with a bedside table and alarm clock between the beds, Two sitting chairs and table, A large unit containing drawers and cupboard below the TV, A large flat screen TV, Fridge, Coffee maker, Microwave, large walk in wardrobe (Closet), Ironing board, Iron and a safe. The room also had it's own air conditioning unit and free wireless internet access. The bathroom was a good size with a large mirror and sink area, toilet and a low level bath and shower The shower did have a strange attachment that produced a rain effect as one of the settings. The breakfast was reasonable including three cereals, a selection of cakes and pastries, bagels and bread that could be toasted and a waffle maker. There was also fresh fruit and plenty of juices and plenty of tea and coffee. A member of staff was regularly clearing up and keeping the cakes and pastries topped up. The area surrounding the hotel felt reasonably safe, we walked along Vermont Ave (Left from the Hotel) in the afternoon and found a selection of shops, including a small supermarket and plenty of placed to eat including McDonalds about half a mile up the road. There are also plenty of petrol (gas) stations along the road. The area after dark felt reasonably safe, we felt safe enough to walk from the metro station to the hotel after midnight. In summary - The hotel is a good location for travellers not using a car as it is in a great location on the Metro Red line that can take you to the Hollywood/Highland station where the Walk of Fame and Chinese Theatres can be found, Universal Studios (Universal City Station) and Union Street Station for Trains and LAX Flyway. The Hotel also has a car park and only a few blocks away from a free way. The not so good stuff - The dÃ©cor might not be to everyone's taste yellow and green in the room. Some of the paint was peeling around the edges such as at the bottom of the doors, the outlook from a lot of the rooms is onto other buildings, the breakfast selection is limited compared to other hotels and the breakfast room is small. The hotel is not in the centre of Hollywood and is certainly not near Universal Studios compared to other Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place! Don't even bother”
Reviews.Author: Justin W
Reviews.Content: I would give zero star if I could. The owner/manager is the rudest and most unprofessional person I've ever seen in a hotel business, no smile, no greetings, just a plain stone face! All he cares about is your pocket and nothing more!

Reviews.Title: “We are very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: As we checked in everything was fine, but when we checked out it was terrible, because Mr.KHALIL was in charge of reception that day and we would ask that the grand total of our stay .... and he said one amount and seconds after he change the figures. To understand me better, to make the booking the hotel were $ 1109.91 USD, of course plus 14% Taxes & 1.50% city taxes. Towards a final total of $ 1281.93USD But when I checked out he was charging me $ 1388.00USD. It was there that I asked to speak with the boss of the hotel, and when I told him what was going on and Mr. Khalil said then that computer error but was not his error... and I just checked my C.C. and I have 2 more charges I have no idea why, but I will find out, and believe me they have no idea with who they are dealing with. Ladies and gentlemen, the truth is it is not worth staying in the COMFORT INN NEAR UNIVERSAL STUDIOS HOLLYWOOD [--] It's a horrible and terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Its all in the eye of the beholder”
Reviews.Author: bb1687
Reviews.Content: As others have said about this hotel, if you're from the middle of no where USA, or you don't travel a lot, you might have diffrent thoughts about this place. I personally thought this place was great for its location and price. My friends, who are more sheltered then my husband and I were aghast that the cashier in the gas station next door was behind glass. lol I'm from small town USA, but i'm well traveled in my peer group and i would stay here again. It was clean, the staff was friendly. I would be cautious, but i didn't feel unsafe or threated by the neighbor hood. It is close to what we wanted to see in LA and it was easy to find. There is a metro stop less than a block away. However, beware when booking, this is not the comfort inn near Hollywood BLVD, its a short driving distance from it, but its not walking distance. For some reason its difficult to tell which one is which when booking. I thought we were in the other one but no. From the reviews, i'm not the only one that has made this mistake. The parking garage here is small so if you have a larger car, beware. We came back late at night and had trouble parking.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you only need a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: MamaMel73
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very outdated. Pipes were leaking in the garage. The staff was less than interested that we were there. Security doors were propped open and that made us a little nervous. Neighboor is a little scarey. Bathroom faucet was hanging off of it's bracket and I asked for one extra towel and they did not have one available. Breakfast was day old food and extremely crowded and confusing. Everything was stale including the cereal. If you are looking just for a place to sleep this place is tolerable. If we were staying any longer than 16 hours I would have moved to another location. Next time we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: nacdac
Reviews.Content: although this hotel is ok if you are in LA for just one night and need a bed for the night , i would advise finding somewhere else in you are in town for longer. the hotel itself is in need of some updating ,the public areas are very dark. the area the hotel is in does not feel safe after dark (this was the view of the whole family). the breakfast buffet was ok and the staff on duty were very good .

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Inexpensive and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: nooriginalnameleft
Reviews.Content: Tourists who want a great base of operation would do well to choose this hotel. If you are the kind who goes out all day and comes in dog tired and just wants a clean, inexpensive and convenient place to hang your hat, this is it. Sure it doesn't have any amenities and no social places around it. But the staff is super friendly (Peter, the manager remembered my name and used it each time he saw me during my stay), the rooms are clean and the price is great. You ARE looking for inexpensive, right? Then don't moan about the lack of places to go after dark (there are none) or charming cafes around (zilch) but instead be happy that steps away from the hotel is the metro to zoom you to wherever you want to go. Situated halfway between downtown (great theatres, STAPLES Center, LA LIVE etc.) and Universal City Walk on the metro line, you should be happy to have a nice room to come to after a long day of traveling. A very good, but often times crowded, continental breakfast including hard boiled egges, waffles, juices and muffins is served daily. Look, this is not luxery but as I said the rooms are clean and room 203 is HUGE (Although it faces a very busy street, it was pretty quiet). If you want a bit fancier, pay for it and don't complain. But for a room that is clean (nice towels!!) and accomodating, I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “ok budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamme5
Reviews.Content: the pictures look a lot better than it actually is. the hotel could really use some updates, the room was stuffy, and the bathroom was very aged (like no renovations decades!), the walls were thin and there was a lot of noise from the other rooms . everything seemed old & needed replacing except a few things. the beds were comfortable although there was a brown stain on one of our top sheets (it looked laundered though) and my child refused to sleep in that bed. the breakfast was ok, but there were not enough tables and we saw many people taking food back to their rooms or eating in the lobby. the staff was very nice and accomodating, but it is a basic budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away fro this place!”
Reviews.Author: Really1111
Reviews.Content: Location was decent. No parking on the streets so, u must pay extra for parking. Pool very small and look dirty. When I first arrived ther was dirty sheets and garbage bags all the way down the hall. Which sat there for 3 hours. Everything was painted dark and very little lighting. T.v. Didn't work. Cracked wall, hairs and stains on bed sheets. And on top off it all.... The second day I was there I found mouse poop in the bathroom. Oh and I can't forget the $300.00 extra that was charge on my card. And this was after I paid in full and checked out. I'm glad I check my card statements often. Otherwise they would have left those bogus charges on there. Not even the manager could explain why that happened. Stay far far away !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, Fantastic accomadation, Brilliant management”
Reviews.Author: k91034
Reviews.Content: This is our first stay in LA and it was our last stop on our holiday where we had been to LAS VEGAS + HAWAII and it was a really nice location, the rooms were very good had fridge, microwave and a excellent tv and air con machine and the room was spotless very clean. The location is fantastic as within 75 metres you are at the entrance to the metro (underground) where you can get a day ticket for only $6 or one way $1.50 and you can go all over LA, universal studios, walk of fame and many top quality shopping areas all within 10 minutes (if that). I spoke to the manager PETER as prior to our arrival i wanted to go on a few trips with the family and a trip on a live shooting range, he was so helpfull giving every trip the personal touch with best advice on how to get there ( A great credit for a good company). We took a city tour following advice from PETER which was the best way to see LA, we visited Beverly hills saw all star homes, Rodeo drive, santa monica and veinece beach and it was all AWESOME. When we were to leave Peter even arranged our transport which was a massive lincoln vehicle and it did cost the same price as a yellow cab for LAX ($60) WHICH IS A GREAT PRICE OVERAL THIS COMFORT INN IS LOCATED IN A QUIET LOCATION WITH EASY ACCESS TO ALL LA WHETHER BY METRO OR BUS MANY THANKS TO ALL IN COMFORT INN Paul AKA K9

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, yummy breakfast and comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Trissy_Ash
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked out this morning from comfort inn. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel mainly because of the location. We only caught 1 taxi while in LA and that was from the airport to hotel about $75. Metro train station right next door - 10mins to downtown and 15 to universal city and Hollywood. We also caught the bus to Venice beach today takes about an hour but much cheaper than taxi!! Our room 203# was massive.. Our friends room wasn't as big but still spacious and the beds are huge and very comfortable. Breakfast is also good waffles bagels etc. Obviusly not 5 star but great for $86/night

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, close to Hollywood and Downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: HCM521
Reviews.Content: The Inn is clean and neat, parking is secure and on site. Very courteous service and our every need was taken care of promptly. The continental breakfast is very good, fresh fruits, waffles, cereals, bagels, toast. juices and coffee. Quick and easy in the mornings. The location is great, close to Hollywood and Downtown Los Angeles. There is a 24 hour restaurant across the street. I will be traveling to Los Angeles again soon and I will stay at this Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Allstar Weekend”
Reviews.Author: MzLinky
Reviews.Content: Upon first arriving at the Comfort Inn the staff was very friendly. My stay here was enjoyable and in the heart of the city where all of the activities were held. I did'nt have to travel far to get anywhere. We were about 10 minutes away from downtown LA and 10 minutes away from Bev Hills. My trip was fantastic, thank you Comfort Inn and all of your staff for a great weekend ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Great Service, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: stevereviews
Reviews.Content: I ended up with a king-size bed and a jacuzzi tub in an immaculate room. While the hotel's on a busy street, the room was very quiet. The parking is secure in a garage and it's literally right next door to LA's clean and efficient subway that's a much better way to go to Hollywood/Highland (Kodak Theater, walk of fame) and then onto Universal Studios than to drive there. Parking's a nightmare and expensive around both these tourist attractions. If you're adventurous, you could take the subway all the way from LAX and if you want to go to beverly hills, just get on the bus that goes down Beverly Blvd. Yes, it's in a working-class area, but it's safe and the people at the hotel are GREAT! GM Peter Ahir is really friendly and leads a solid team. The breakfast bar was tastey and FREE and so is the wi-fi. Ironic that hotels that cost 3-times as much - like the Beverly Hilton, charge lots of money for all the things you get here free. I will stay here again. Work usually puts me up at either the Four Seasons or the Beverly Hilton so I'm pretty picky - and I'm not about to pay that kind of money when I want to spend extra time in Los Angeles. This is a great option in a very central, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel... but the location wasn't that great.”
Reviews.Author: fleurbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed three night in this hotel, and were pleased with what we got. The staff was friendly and the room was surprisingly spacious. There was free wifi and the continental breakfast wasn't all that bad. We had the same thing each day, from cereal, muffins, bagels and a self-made waffle machine, but it was surprisingly decent. The replenished the bread basket quite quickly so it didn't matter at what time you went down for breakfast. There will always be food. Each day, our room was cleaned and made, and they replaced the towels and toiletries. There was only one downside and that is its location. It was located near the subway, but there were some mean looking homeless guys, which makes it unsafe to be walking near the hotel during the night. There was one peculiar thing about this hotel, its name. Unlike what its name suggests, it is nowhere near Universal Studios, and certainly NOT within walking distance to Hollywood. Some other reviewers may have gotten confused between this hotel and another Comfort Inn. This hotel is surrounded by gas stations, and not anywhere near any touristy spots in LA. However, due to its good rooms i would definitely stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Travel, maybe....Convenience definitely. NOISY people upstairs”
Reviews.Author: Rich16
Reviews.Content: 2nd time staying at this hotel, only thing that made me go back was the fact that its right beside an MTA subway Station(red line - Vermont/Berverly Station, Convenience) and for the amount i paid it wasnt that bad ($70-1 night) , but the check in clerk(same as my last visit) upgraded my room, although i was only a Gold Elite Choice Privileges Member, it says there upgrades are only available to Diamond Elite members, and this time, i wasnt charged for parking...or any safe usage charge... only one thing that ruined it was the people staying on a higher floor over my room that were so noisy, at 12 midnight you could hear them walk back and forth their room, i could understand if it was 9am to maybe 9pm, 12 MIDNIGHT??? i think thats the last time for this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: big47al
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, large clean rooms, basic but good breakfast, and convenient to the Metro. Peter on reception was outstanding, couldn't help enough to everyone. Good economic food close by and also supermarkets

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bmxmom38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at COmfort Suites cause everything else was booked that weekend. The room was very clean and above standards. Location was great - walking distance to Hollywood Blvd near Madame Tussands Wax Museum, Kodak Theatre, Grauman;s Chinese theater. Also had a great view of the HOLLYWOOD sign. Hotel gave us directions to drive closer to the hollywood sign. SO amazing. Would definitely stay there again when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Close for trip to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: EMA2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel only for the convenience of being close to Unviersal. The room was clean & decent, but we were placed right outside the ice making machine....! Not much else to report....

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there...please!!!”
Reviews.Author: cricri7
Reviews.Content: My review has been a long time coming but I feel the responsability to do it once and for all. I stayed 2 nights at this hotel in February during the course of a school trip. We were a group of 3 teachers and 23 grade 9 students from Montreal that were on a school trip to California and the Grand Canyon. We had stayed in a Hampton inn in South San Francisco and then took a bus to get to LA. I had called the hotel a week before to ask them to put us on the second floor since we were with minors and we did not want them going out the window in the middle of the night. The guy on the phone assured me that everything would be in order when we would get there.....are you guessing the end of the story? Almost all the rooms were with a window facing a large balcony that other rooms could access. I immediately went downstairs to have the issue resolved, even if it was past 10 o'clock at night, and I have to give thanks to the night manager that changed every room to other rooms that did not have balconies. He was not too happy but I did not give him a choice. I told him that they were minors and that it was his responsability to do so. The kids were very disappointed because we had been in a nice and clean hotel room in San Francisco and ended up in dirty hotel rooms that were scary. I did not sleep a wink all night because people were going up and down the corridor. I looked through the peephole and noticed that it was gentlemen with women. It is probably a hotel where prostitutes take clients. Let's just say that it is not a hotel where you want to take 15 year olds!!!! The rooms were disgusting....the curtains were dirty....the sheets were dirty....the bedspread was dirty....I was thoroughly disgusted with the place. It was also scary as hell. The only redeeming aspects are the fact that they switched my students to rooms that did not have balconies and the fact that they allowed us to have a pizza party in their breakfast room. We came in late from our day of sightseeing and did not feel like going out to dinner to a restaurant in the area...did I mention scary area also? The night manager, Peter I think is his name, helped us find specials on pizza and the kids were so happy to come down in their pyjamas to eat pizza and talk until curfew time. Since we did not allow them to have parties in their rooms, the setting was perfect for them. I would discourage anyone to stay there. It is a vile place where the manager does his best with what he has. It is not his fault at all that Comfort Inns keeps an establishment like this one under their banner!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Vacation_Gal_007
Reviews.Content: My only concern about this hotel is the location. It is in a shady neighborhood with transients roaming about; nonetheless, it is pretty safe. Stayed there for 2 nights. The hotel was clean. The room was decent; it was clean and spacious. It has a small fridge and microwave. The beds were comfortable and linens were clean (no bed bugs!) The room has a 32" flat screen panel HDTV which I though was funny since it's a budget hotel. Cannot comment on the free breakfast because we wanted to venture and check out the local eateries (recommend going to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffle -- YUM!) Overall, the hotel was okay and would recommend it. The BIG plus side is that it is right next to the Metro Red Line which will take you anywhere in Los Angeles. We just parked our car in the hotel and took the Metro (parking is below the hotel and is safe.) I highly recommend taking the Metro. It is not only clean and safe but also cheap! If you are staying in this hotel, then most likely you are on a budget, so the Metro is a great tip for you budget travelers. With the Metro we were able to go to Union Station, Oliveras Street, Chinatown, Little Tokyo, Universal Studios, Hollywood & Vine, and other tourist areas. One way ticket is $1.25, but for a whole day it is only $5 (unlimited rides.) There are not a lot of restaurants near the hotel and I would not recommend walking at night looking for places to eat. Just take the Metro (literally less than 2 mins walk from the hotel) and it will drop you off in good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Low Budget Hotel for L.A Area”
Reviews.Author: DivaSoloTraveler
Reviews.Content: As a single female who had never been to LA before I traveled there for a conference and a mini 4 day vacation to check out some tourist sites. My conference was in the Hollywood Blvd area, so I quickly booked a hotel in the same area, but a month later found trip advisor and learned that my hotel was subpar and other accommodations in the area were either to much money for not a lot of features or to much money for seriously subpar accommodations (e.g.- bedbugs, renovation incomplete, horrible customer service, etc). I also learned through the LAPD website that the crime rate in Hollywood area was concerning, as I would be heading back to my hotel between 8pm and 11pm a night after finding a place to eat dinner, safety was optimal for me as I was alone. So after reviewing over 12 hotels in the LA area I booked this Comfort Inn hotel, as most reviews were good and the bad ones were from people who didnâ€™t do their research first and had â€œDivaâ€� like high expectations for a low budget hotel in L.A. I would recommend before booking any hotel go on "Google Map Quest" and take a street view tour of the address to see what the area looks like. Why I picked this hotel and what I liked about it was as follows: 1. I picked this location because I was using public transit for my entire trip including going to Santa Monica, Long Beach, The Grove, North Hollywood (Universal Studioâ€™s & Jay Leno Show) and to and from the airport which is easy and cheap. Comfort Inn is literally 20 to 30 steps from the top of the stairs of the Vermont Subway Station. 2. It is located on a very busy street even at 11pm at night (cars and people are there) so you donâ€™t feel isolated. 3. For the price point of a low budget hotel in a large city like LA, I found the front desk clerks to be very friendly, receptive and made me feel welcomed and that they valued my business. I was able to ask them any question no matter how ridiculous and they answered it with a smile. 4. I had very low expectations for my room so I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door. There was a nice flat screen TV, large dresser with marble top, small clean fridge, microwave and coffee maker. My only advise is make sure the fridge is plugged in before putting any food inside and make sure the temperature gauge is set to #6 or more as your food won't stay. 5. The bathroom was clean, had a nice marble counter over sink and housekeeping always changed my towels and I liked the presentation of making it look like a fan. It's those little details that are nice. As an eco-friendly conscious person I liked the little sign on my night side table that gave me the option to not have my bed sheets changed by placing it on the pillow each morning, which I used frequently. 6. There were no bedbugs or insects period which was nice. The room did have a mild odour but it was because the room was very warm with the sun shinning in, so any odor in the carpet rose but nothing offensive. 7. I liked the queen bed I had which was firm the way I like it and huge. The pillows were big and soft. If youâ€™re a light sleeper ask for a room on the side or back of the hotel. 8. I liked the complimentary breakfast which is included in the cost of your room. I didnâ€™t expect to find eggs and so I was pleasantly surprised to have boiled eggs at breakfast. I hope they someday offer scrambled eggs as an option here and there. There is also a Dennyâ€™s literally half a block up the street you can see it at the street lights from the hotel door and as a person who doesn't really eat in Denny's I had my best dinner meal of my whole stay in there for a cheap price on my last night in town. My only complaint is that the ice machine is very loud as it make ice and louder when someone goes to take ice. Iâ€™m a Canadian from a large city so I have been exposed to many cultures and have seen and worked with the homeless, so I personally donâ€™t have a fear of other cultures or homeless people. This hotel is probably not for people who come from small towns or cities where they have never been exposed to or fear other cultures (especially Hispanic and African Americans- *please note I am of Carribean decent so that statement isn't ment to be racist ) or of the homeless, as there are a very few homeless people in the area, but they never ever bother or talk to me. I personally felt safe around them and they knew I was a tourist because they saw me come out of the subway with my suitcase. If youâ€™re on a tight budget and contemplating renting a car; donâ€™t. I took the transit everywhere it only cost $1.25 to $1.50 per bus or train or you can pay $5.00 for a day pass and ride all day anywhere. Donâ€™t buy a week pass if you donâ€™t arrive on a Saturday as their week passes are preset to Saturday to Saturday for $17 I got ripped off by the check cashing place I bought my from on a Thursday for $17 and they didnâ€™t tell me it expire on Saturday. Overall, I would stay here again as for the price point and location (especially to public transit); I was able to spend that extra money I saved touring and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “DANGEROUS. FIRE HAZARD. DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: musicandmedia
Reviews.Content: Did my subject get your attention? It's true. I've traveled a lot for both business and pleasure, and never have I encountered as extreme a circumstance in a hotel as we did yesterday. Very, very long story short: My wife and I arrived at our hotel last night about 10:00 after a day of sightseeing. Our room was full of smoke and smelled like something was burning. The front desk guy, who was ESL and very difficult to understand, said that the property manager "liked to cook" in the room next to ours, and had apparently left something in the microwave. All afternoon and evening. That is irresponsible enough, but more disturbing was the fact that NO SMOKE OR FIRE ALARMS WERE GOING OFF, AFTER HOURS OF SMOKE IN THE ADJACENT ROOM. The hotel was acting as if this were business-as-usual, trying to pooh-pooh our concerns. Front desk guy offered us another room, but wifey and I decided we were not willing to risk our lives (and the smell of our belongings) by subjecting ourselves to two further nights at this place -- so we checked out and rebooked at another local Comfort Inn. I'd also like to interject here that this travel was booked on rewards points. We shopped for this hotel based on its relatively low per-night points cost. When this all went down at 11:00 last night, we didn't have time or resources to patiently comparison-shop our replacement lodging. I called Choice Hotels reservations, who booked me to the new hotel, told me they did not have the authority to refund points and resolve other billing issues, but that I should call customer service in the morning, with whom my issue would almost certainly be completely taken care of. This morning, I found myself on the phone with two very rude people in customer service at Choice Hotels. They offered to refund the points for my two unused nights (big whoop), plus a 10,000 point bonus for the inconvenience. This did not come close to covering the cost of the nights at the hotel we had to switch to under duress -- again, forced out by smoke in the middle of the night. At the time of writing this review, this issue remains unresolved, and I shall be speaking with a supervisor's supervisor on Monday morning. Anything less than making us whole on this without any further cost to us (money or points) is unacceptable to me, bad business as it relates to frequent customers, and will eliminate Choice Hotels as a competitor for any of my future hotel business. Bottom line: DO NOT stay at this Comfort Inn location. It is unsafe. Don't know what the fire marshall is doing in this precinct, but he should check this place out for sure. Personally, I would never recommend that anyone I care about stay at any Choice Hotels location after this incident and the subsequent dealings with their "customer no-service"... but that is up to your discretion. (Unrelated to the above incident: Before this incident even happened, we had stayed in the hotel one night. We'd already decided it was rather run-down and not totally clean, as well as being located in "the hood." If you're in L.A. as a tourist, you won't want to walk around this hotel's neighborhood. More reasons not to stay here.)

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a nice, clean, relaxing hotel experience...this is NOT it.”
Reviews.Author: hailea3
Reviews.Content: If there is anything good to say about this hotel, it would be that it is very close to the red line metro train and the beds had decent comfort. The location is not in the best neighborhood although there is a Denny's down the street. Upon entering the lobby, it was obvious that this was going to be a pretty run down hotel. Unfortunately, I was not able to get a refund of the reward points I used to book the hotel. The elevator is old, hallways and carpets are old and not very flattering, and you are greeted with a camera at the front of each hallways. The tub in the first room we were assigned was filthy. We requested and received a new room on a different floor. Surprise, same experience. The tub was at least cleaner this time and the room smelled better. The cleanliness is more a reflection of how old and run down the hotel is overall. I am sure the housekeeping does as good a job as they can with what they are provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cludasdulac
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 4 nights, the rooms are clean and spacious. The staff in reception are very friendly and very helpful. Very close to Hollywood and Universal, enjoyed our stay here. Ask if the parking can be included in the price, We did and got free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Once nice, now a [--]”
Reviews.Author: MissKeely
Reviews.Content: My fiance and stayed there this weekend to attend a hockey game at the Staple Center. We were looking for something budget and close to downtown. This is not the worst hotel we have ever stayed at, but its pretty darn crappy. Here are the details, you decide if you would stay here.... 1) We had to pay a $4.25 "surcharge" and $5 to park in their lot, on top of the fee we already paid Travelocity for a one-night stay. $10 bucks for no reason, without being disclosed when we booked?!?!? 2) We booked a king bed and when we got to our room we saw 2 fulls. We went down to get the rooms switched and it was a HUGE DEAL! They said that what we book online isnt guaranteed, and we get whats available when we check in. Our paperwork clearly said king, not "standard room" or anything that might be misconstrued. 3) The furniture was nice at one point, but it is all dinged up, dented, and the paint is missing. The bed spread is nice, but the curtains are covered in crap. There are stains everywhere on them. It really makes me wonder how clean everything else is. 4) The free continental breakfast looked nice from the outside, but there were a number of things wrong with it. The waffle maker excited me, but the batter was all wrong, no matter how long you cooked them the middle was eggy and wet. The orange juice was fake tasting and overly sweet. No peanut butter for the toast. Cereal was stale tasting. Front desk did not care. 5) It is not in the best area. A family next to us has a 3 year old boy who kept a toy gun tucked into his waistband and "fired shots" at breakfast. Cool. Not sure why previous reviewers had good thins to say?? PS They have internet on 1 computer in the lobby, but it is a minimum $5 CC charge.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: flipper2230
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel online beforehand for a few nights and upon arriving I was so shocked at the condition I almost started crying. It is located in a very sketchy looking area. There is graffiti everywhere and it is very rundown and did not feel at all safe. As someone said in an earlier review it was in a ghetto. Our window looked out over what looked like a slum. The hotel itself was like a halfway house. The room was filthy. It reeked of smoke and we were told to get a non-smoking room it would be $10 more a day. The door didn't close, there were cigarette burns all over the beds and the curtains were ripped. A ratty towel held a door in the hallway open. My friend and I are not picky when it comes to hotels. We have been in and out of budget hotels all across the country for the past 2 weeks and have not had any complaints but this one is truly terrible. Do yourself a favor and pay a little more money to stay in a nicer hotel. This hotel may be cheap but its not at all worth it. We checked out about an hour after checking in. Do NOT stay in this absolutely disgusting, filthy place.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: marierika
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price, staff very friendly and helpful, free breakfast was really good. The location, was maybe not the best in the city but we felt safe and it was so close to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit noisy, dated but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ek_NZ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after checking out the Trip Advisor reviews and getting a reasonable price for a well located city hotel on Expedia. The reviews were pretty representative of this place. It is well located on good bus routes and within 30 metres of the Vermont/Beverly metro station. If coming from LAX (I had a one night stay to kill some time after flying in from NZ) I would recommend taking the metro rather than buses unless you want to get a feel for the non-ritzy parts of LA. The buses (2 connections) took almost 2 hours whereas you can get to the hotel in about 40-50mins by metro. I had a Vermont Ave facing room on the 3rd floor. Road noise was apparent (but not deafening) and the aircon - same as for the San Diego Comfort Inn - is too noisy to leave on while you sleep; a consideration to bear in mind in staying in the heat of summer. The room and hotel in general is really quite old/dated but reasonably clean though more fussy people would be a bit disappointed. Certainly wouldn't recommend the stay for a relaxing holiday, but it is ok for a night or two at the right price. Reception staff were reasonably friendly so no complaints there. Breakfast is adequate only unless you love making waffles. I'm unable to compare it to any other inner city hotels of same rating/value but see my review of the Hotel Pepper Tree in Anaheim (great place!!).

Reviews.Title: “Run while you can!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBarbiegirl
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the other posts in that this hotel is in a Korean ghetto. We did not feel safe during the evening hours at this hotel. Upon check-in, 2 African Americans walked thru the lobby, ate the popcorn, and then one of them proceeded to urinate in the garage by the cars...Breakfast was way too crowded-- I felt like we were in Little Mexico. Lots of Spanish speaking people talking loudly during breakfast and it seemed like they brought not only their families, but extended family as well. The location is good to many attractions, but next time I will stay in either Burbank or upgrade to a more expensive hotel--there are plenty of other nice ones to stay where I won't feel as they I am going to get "knifed" on my way back from Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: mybobby123
Reviews.Content: the minute I walked into the room, I noticed a strong odor. mildew in the bathroom. dirty carpets. the place is due to serious updates. breadfast was good. after one night, switched to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and great services”
Reviews.Author: Yannis_78
Reviews.Content: Close to lots of areas of LA and to the 101. Great people there to help you with whatever you need. Room perfectly done everyday and great complimentary breakfast. Also, parking was not too expensive for LA.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly located bargain hotel, but beware of add-on charges!”
Reviews.Author: MaxTLV
Reviews.Content: Located a hundred feet from the red Metro line (Vermont/Beverly), smack in the middle between downtown and Hollywood and a block from the Hollywood freeway, this is a perfect base for exploring Los Angeles. There are inexpensive eateries nearby (google Atlacatl - Salvadorean cuisine, yum!) and larger shops if you need something. This is Koreatown, but people do speak English, prices are low, and we did not feel unsafe at any time. The price was great, but the hotel did surprise us with $5 for WiFi and safes in the room, despite our not using either - the only hotel on this trip (over 15 different hotels) to do so. $5 parking is reasonable. No problems checking in, room in good condition, besides a few damaged spots near the door covered by quaint plastic circles glued on. The breakfast was OK for the hotel class - donuts, waffles, cereal and toast. Our room was with the "road view" (it's across the square and a few trees) and there was no noise problem. Don't know how the gas station-facing rooms are.

Reviews.Title: “depends on how particular you are”
Reviews.Author: PracticalMary
Reviews.Content: I mistook this Comfort Inn for a different one and unfortunately prepaid in a nonrefundable package. I like to walk for exercise and was not comfortable walking in this neighborhood. I thought it had a pool, wrong place. The room was actually spacious but was considered to be a King Jacuzzi Suite. Well, the Jacuzzi located in the corner of the room, didn't have knobs to turn it on. A towel was neatly folded over the missing controls. The bed was comfortable but there were cigarette burn holes in the coverlet of this non-smoking room. The breakfast was okay, we did enjoy the waffles and fruit but the coffee was awful. After two nights of our 7 night stay, we sucked up the cost and checked out!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, run-down, pathetic -- flophouse in a Korean slum”
Reviews.Author: bradtheman
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are totally misleading. Europeans on a budget apparently will tolerate mostly anything, the rest of us will want to stear clear of a hopeless unmaintained dump like this. Face it -- Los Angeles is expensive and there isn't enough quality and affordable rooms near downtown. If you get a "good deal", it's for a reason, and here are the highlights, in no particular order: - drunk homeless man rummaging in trash in the cramped parked lot, give him a dollar won't you? - scenic location in a Korean slum. Can't read Korean? Forget about knowing what goes on in any of the buildings that aren't abandoned. - man who doesn't comprehend the language so well will have trouble locating your reservation, call the 800 number for Comfort Inns so that they can fax him a copy, cool your heels in the lobby amongst the dirty furniture -- it is only a taste of things to come - get to your room and count the holes that have been punched in the walls, they are covered by plastic plates, oh and be careful you don't snag your suit on the missing door frame cover - have the bed covers ever been cleaned? Count the cigarette holes. I stopped at 10. - all the door are sticky. How is that possible? I don't want to know. - Have you ever been in a bathroom where all the grout was missing? I bet you haven't, it's kind of an interesting effect, there is always a place for the water to run. - They kindly taped the remote control together, which turns on your 19" tube TV, circa late 80's model - Did someone wipe their butt on my curtain? Sure looks like it. - Chairs are sooty black. - Did you get the room with the gas station view or the road view? Which is noisier? Which is scarier? Hard to say. - Towels were clean, at least to the eye. Microscopic tests were not conducted. - Which is faster, this place's wireless internet access or morse code? I'm betting on the morse code. - Want to know when your neighbor is using his bathroom? You will hear his toilet flush as well as hear other intimate acts as they take place. - I didn't see any cockroaches. They probably are too disgusted with the place and checked out earlier. - Watch out for homeless people when pulling out of the tight garage, I almost took one out. There is a reason that Comfort Inns is consistently rated the worst or near worst hotel chain, and this place is the epitome of it. You have been warned. It's a coin flip between sleeping in your rental car or this place as to which offers better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Ever”
Reviews.Author: Theatregirl1983
Reviews.Content: I don't know if we just got a really good deal or not but this place was really cheap. The location was brilliant, and the hotel was lovely. We were only here for one night before starting a trip up the coast but it did the job brilliantly and was only Â£5 for parking which even with the room still made it the cheapest place on our trip. The breakfast was also brilliant as they had a waffle making machine, which being British was a definate novelty for us. I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good... with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: ErnieAndArthur
Reviews.Content: On the whole we found this hotel to be very good. The rooms are large, clean, well appointed with TV, ironing etc. the beds are comfortable and everything seemed to work, including the hot-tub. The location is also very good with the freeway close-by. There were no major issues with this hotel; however there is a couple of things which spoiled the experience which is only fair to write about... Firstly - the breakfast room only holds a very small/finite amount of people and gets very crowded. There are only five or six tables which are very large but don't seat many people as they are round. We found most mornings that we either had to eat in the lobby or go back to our rooms (spilling coffee along the way!). The breakfast is also pretty sparse. This mornings' offering for example only included slices of bread (for toast), butter and jam/jelly, waffles (which you must wait in line and cook yourself - but are very good), some apples, and a variety of 3 cereals (Cheerios, Trix, Total). The coffee can be variable from watery to normal. In the room there is an issue whenever someone next door or above you flushes the toilet or has a shower/hot-tub... you can basically hear the pipes/water... and loud! Also - being an ex-smoker it was mildly annoying to be placed in a room in which the entrance was on an open-air balcony (most room doors are indoors)... therefore making it a meeting place for all smokers late into the night - the associated chattering and smell of smoke annoyed me at best. In my opinion - if the hotel could rectify the breakfast issue this would easily be a 5 out of 5. If you can overlook that part then you will have no worries here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views on this one...”
Reviews.Author: Rich16
Reviews.Content: It would have been a perfect stay if it was automated check in, but of course we have to deal with people who probably dont know what they're doing, first of all, he gave us a room with people already in it, hmmm duh? next room, the jacuzzi didnt work, (i got a picture of the tub without the all important knob "they did give me a refund of the safe and telecom charge "which i never used" due to the tub not working properly) just watch out for billing "only at this hotel they would ask you if you had a car(which i didnt have and told them about this) but still charge you parking, at the Downey comfort inn or any other choice hotel i stayed at never charged me for parking, ever, whether they asked if i had a car or not. so after emailing the manager, which he never answered until i contacted choice hotels. finally giving me the refund of the parking fee. if only you dont have to deal with people, i would have rated this hotel a perfect 5... too bad, P.S. Perfect location for hotel if you travel by Subway, its right beside the Vermont/Beverly MTA Stop, another thing going for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Experience was great.”
Reviews.Author: jfarnan
Reviews.Content: When my sister and I arrived we were a little taken back becuase we thought the outside would be nicer than it appeared to us and once we got inside the sofas kind of needed to be replaced but when Peter checked us in he was very friendly and helpful. The room was excellent and very clean and that made us feel alot better. Peter helped us get any tours that we wanted and really helped us out alot. The metro was only a half block down the street and we took it almost anywhere we wanted to go, that just made out hotel stay even better. The continental breakfast was really good and fresh and if you wanted to get dinner, Dennys was just up the street. All in all our stay at the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Washyourhands
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with all the creature comforts i expected. My husband and I had been planning a stay in LA for a while and were very picky about which hotels we were staying at. We are used to staying at places like the Omni and Wilshire Grand but were on a tighter budget this year. This hotel is amazing! It was real value for money. I couldnt find one fault with the rooms which were a good size and had plenty of space for our 4 pieces of lugguage and my hoard of cosmetics. Theres ample parking, and the location is great! We were able to access all the hotspots of LA using this as a base with ease (disneyland, hollywood etc) we even managed an impromtu visit to Las Vegas and to San Diego. Also as we are both muslims we found local mosques and halal meat not a problem. Breakfast was great with cereal, juices, fruit, fresh dougnuts and pastries (which were replenished when empty and delicious) and we were able to come down at half nine and still get breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helped us in every way possible. Basically all in all this hotel is a gem amongst all the grotty cheap hotels in LA. We will definately come back and cant recommend it enough. If your worried about cleanliness or service then please dont be as this is fantastic in both respects.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, great location for exploring L.A./Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: amiellen
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel, the complimentary breakfast was just the ticket for a group of teenagers. Metro is literally next to the hotel. Comfortable beds; the manager, Peter is helpful and nice. They will add a roll away to a double queen room. Did I mention I brought a group of teen exchange students on a trip here? $10 parking fee is reasonable. Micros, mini-fridge and coffee maker in room, as well as good hair drier in bathroom. Really, once you arrive you could just take the metro and leave the car parked. If you are here to do downtown L.A., Hollywood, Universal... this is a good location. Neighborhood is typical urban. It is NOT the ghetto, but it is not suburbia either. Also, it is a straight shot up Vermont to Griffith Park Observatory. Arrive by 10am because it gets crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: dashfast321
Reviews.Content: A gem of a budget hotel. Clean, helpful staff, next door to metro links - great value for money. The free breakfast is more than you could ask for - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A good, simple, convenient budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: a1cheung
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Comfort Inn in North Vermont Ave for the first 3 nights of our LA trip. We stayed in a standard queens/double room on the first floor. The room was simple, clean, and moderately sized as expected. The front desk staff member was helpful in directing us to nearby amenities such as transport and restaurants. The hotel also includes breakfast, which was a nice selection of cereals, pastries, waffles, and boiled egg, plus a selection of juice, as well as coffee and tea. Location of the hotel was also very good for travellers who donâ€™t have access to a private vehicle. It is very close to the subway, with the train line that goes directly to Hollywood entertainment area and Universal studio. There is also a bus not too far away that takes you to Beverly Hills. There are some fast food restaurants nearby, including well-known ones such as Yoshinoya, Dennyâ€™s, and McDonalds a little further away. A grocery store that sells seafood, and grocery is a block or so away. I donâ€™t recall any night life in the area (bars etc.), so it is pretty much just TV back in the hotel after dinner. It is budget hotel with all the essentials â€“ cleanliness, convenience, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Simple Tastes”
Reviews.Author: Alamojoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 20-24 November 2008. IMHO, for the money this place offers good value. Because of the economy and its impact on my travel budget, I had to find a nice, clean place to hang my hat, be in an acceptable location for access to the general area (Hollywood, Studio City, LAX, etc., and be secure; all that for a reasonable sumâ€¦ and getting that â€œreasonable sumâ€� element on track can be a daunting task in Southern Calâ€¦especially for a last minute booking. Because of the comments on this board, I was steered here and fortunate to get into this hotel on short notice. The location is good with quick access to the 101. My room was clean and well appointed; everything worked. Bathroom was nice; towels were abundant. The furniture & carpet was updated and fresh. There was the requisite in-room safe to store my laptop and other valuables when necessary. As previously mentioned, the beds were very comfortable and the general atmosphere was pleasant & quiet. My room was towards the rear of the facility on the 2nd floor, so you may want to request a room away from the front which faces North Vermont Ave. (a busy city thoroughfare)â€¦ if you are extremely noise sensitive. The wireless internet connection worked without any glitches and is included free of charge. There are numerous restaurants and grocery stores nearby and one can walk if youâ€™re so inclined and /or feeling adventurous. I would not recommend any late night strolls, but I found the area to be OK; no Beverly Hillsâ€¦but no slum either! There are lots a cool Asian-run businesses everywhere around. Parking is typical of any big city; there is a reasonable $5 per night chargeâ€¦ but itâ€™s covered, well lit and I never had a problem finding a parking space, howbeit tight (leave the Suburban at home unless you have major parking skills (lol) . The Manager, Peter, was always helpful and customer support was good. The included breakfast is simple and apart from the fruit and fruit juices, not orientated for maximum healthy living as I likeâ€¦ but it was OK to fill the gap. (I would love to have seen some bran muffins & oatmeal thrown in the mix; then it would have been AOK for me!) I found this to be a clean place, with good bed in a decently appointed room, together with reasonable security, easy access to the freeway system and inclusive of a staff that seemed ready to do whatever it would take to make my stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: tbonSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Usually when i stay at a hotel, the first night I toss and turn and the next night I sleep just from exhaustion. The beds at Comfort Inn were SO comfortable I fell right to sleep and slept all night. Awesome pillows, good sheets too. Nobody likes to sleep in hard, scratchy sheets. Peter at the front desk was so helpful. I will definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to stay in a nice, friendly, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: travel_trekkin
Reviews.Content: the rooms were really nice with all black furniture, no frills basically a small fridge., bedside stands,chair and desk, nice size tv. bathroom was nice and was cleaned every day. it was actually more than i expected BUT i did see a few roaches in my room the night before i left and i was charged a few dollars a day for hotel fees that i didn't know about before hand but those were the only problems i had with the whole experience. i had a decent sized room for one person. breakfast was the basic essentials: fruit salad, cereal, muffins, donuts/pastry coffee, waffels, juice, water.i didn't have much interaction with the staff or needed any questions answered except check in and out and they seem pretty friendly. i didn't have a car but the beverly/vermont station is literally a few steps away. the neighborhood is no west hollywood but i didn't feel uncomfortable walking to and from the metro late at night being a solo female traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Management and Best Value”
Reviews.Author: WayneOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: Best Value in Los Angeles. Management always helpful and accomodating. Peter, the Manager, is professional and very helpful. Great location and good parking. I always stay there when on business in Los Angles. Just ask for Peter and your stay will be great! Wayne

Reviews.Title: “Basic and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveM_Sunderland
Reviews.Content: Great value for money for basic hotel central to the all the sights of LA. We stayed here for the first 4 nights of a 3 week tour of California with our 2 children and it met our needs perfectly. Desk staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. Waffle maker was a big hit with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “it was ok, but it smelled”
Reviews.Author: calicutiepie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the staff was friendly. Our room also had a jacuzzi which was very nice. The problem was that our room had this horrible stale, musty smell. We tried to leave our AC on to circulate the room, but the staff had turned it off when then came to our room. When we came back our room had a horrible smell and felt like a sauna. So if you are sensitive to smells at all I wouldnt recommend the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “An experience”
Reviews.Author: Lakeside31
Reviews.Content: Shabby hotel, but mostly clean unless you look out of the window. No towel racks in the bathroom. During a shower, the faucet totally detached from the tub, hitting me and cutting my ankle. The desk clerk and maintenance responded quickly and fixed the tub, but were unconcerned about my leg. The location of the hotel is good for quick access to the Metro, but I wouldn't walk around the area at night. Denny's Restaurant is across the street, and a Vons grocery store is a block or two away. The complimentary breakfast was good, with sliced fresh fruit and strong coffee. Staff were all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it, we walked out................”
Reviews.Author: bartondarr
Reviews.Content: No one told the people at Expedia they were in the midst of renovating this dump. Our room was right in the midst of being renovated, with all the other rooms beside us under major renos as well...................noise and dust. The entire place smells old, musty, it needs a major overhaul to say the least. The pictures shown on the websites are old, most likely done when those items were new, because they sure do not look like that now. The entire place looks very rundown, worn out, in need of a lot of TLC. Its not in a very nice end of town, as we were warned not to go out after 10 pm, and that our car was on its own even in their parking lot. They charge you an additional $5 per day for parking, plus $4.75 per day for "safety fees". For the price the hotel charges, .........blah.........I had 100 times better in Vegas for less. Maybe after a major overhaul, but for now, stay somewhere else. Oversea visitors however may find it most charming, as its more comparable to hotels overseas. But..............the staff were very friendly, extremely helpful and very accomodating!!!.....AAA on their part. Between them and Expedia, they graciously refunded our entire money back, and helped us find something different. 2 thumbs up to Expedia for that !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmshedd
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and it seems the hotel has just gone thru an updating. Nice modern ammenities. Bathrooms had marble countertops and new tile. The front desk was very courteous. Would definitily stay here again. The hotel had easy access to Hollywood Blvd. and local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I guess I was expecting a bit more for the money, but the hotel was fine. Only 3 major problems I noticed: our room didn't have a screen in the window, and we kept putting a note to keep the window closed, but the maids always opened the window and left it open, so our room would get full of flies and get warm while we were gone. The other problem was that the parking spots in the hotel were VERY tight. It wasn't easy to park at all. Also, when we were checking out, I happened to look inside the office of the front desk clerk and there was a sign posted that said, "Warning: This building is known to contain agents that can cause cancer and reproductive harm." Something like that sohuld probably be posted somewhere else so people can actually see it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a great place to stay. The room was clean and smelled fine (i.e., no funky odors). It was also quiet as long as the window was shut. The free continental breakfast had toast, pastries, donuts, juice, coffee, tea, and cereal. The furniture and wallpaper/carpet was run-down, but for the price, it was fine. Also, there was a microwave and coffee maker in the room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The underground parking cost $5/night and was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ALIAS1
Reviews.Content: Traveling alone as a female it was very important to me that I felt safe. The neighborhood was not the best but the free covered parking made me feel safe. The Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with directions. The room was clean for the most part but could seriously use some updates. The wallpaper was peeling and the carpet could use some cleaning. The free breakfast was nice and there was plenty of food every morning. Overall, this hotel was decent enough for what I needed but I would probably try another hotel next time. Although its not a bad hotel if you just need a quick over night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: brandy_76
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel expecting the worst, but was surprised to see a clean lobby with couches & tv. The hotel staff was very friendly, immediately giving me maps of the area. Room was very big with a desk area - bathroom & room clean. It could use some new carpeting & furniture as the room had a slight "old" odor to it. The best part is there's a Denny's right across the street & a Metro subway station a few doors down. All in all it's great for the money & not too far away from the tourist area. I would stay here again if I was on a budget, but if money is not an issue I'd rather stay at the bigger hotels where you're in walking distance to lots of stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jalu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week while attending a conference - for the money I really can't complain and indeed liked the place. While the bath tub was a bit small for me, the staff were friendly and the lobby was very nice, as were the rooms (if a bit basic and lacking wireless internet access). The hotel is slap bang next to a subway station (great for tourists, $3 to Universal Studios - beats the cab fare) and 5 minutes walk away from some shops. Top stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Worked just fine”
Reviews.Author: RunnerWoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight after arriving on an evening flight and continuing on early the next morning. We had no illusions about grandeur or neighborhood. This hotel was just fine for our purposes. The price was right, and the free parking was a nice perk. Yes, the room was quite dated, but it was mostly clean. The old light switches should be replaced; they have years worth of grime imbedded in them. The continental breakfast was the usual fare, with an unusual addition of real doughnuts (not the supermarket kind). The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Under the same circumstances we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Dubontheroad
Reviews.Content: Location wasnt great. Even our taxi driver suggested we move elsewhere as the neighbourhood was rough. Hotel was very basic. On the plus side there was free parking, free breakfast and very helpful staff. (Peter - you are the sweetest!). If I was to stay in LA again I would get a hotel near the beach - or Bevery Hills if I could afford it!

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated and needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Brodders
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Expedia. Comments on this hotel are mainly right - the rooms need redecorated, carpets renewed etc. Rooms are a good size. It is in an excellent position to see Hollywood and LA. Has free covered parking. Breakfast was good but don't leave it too late otherwise all the pastries will be gone. Staff ok but not overly helpful. Wouldn't stay here again, would try and find something a bit more cleaner and more modern.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front clerks were nice. However, the towels were so old and thread bare that I couldn't beleive I was using them on my body. The shower nozzle kept turning off and on, but thank goodness I'm a good fix it person. Since I left one of my best purses in a drawer, let's see how honest the employees are in sending it back to me, a few days will tell. This is a great motel for a crash pad. It is clean and I felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first room they gave us smelled like cat ****. The next room they moved us to, sprang a leak from the upstairs toilet and soaked our bathroom toiletries and person effects and once more, they had us move. They say 100% satisfaction garrenteed, but these are such lies. They have no idea what customer service is, the front desk person carried on a phone conversation for 10 minutes in Punjab, totally ignoring me, until hi boss came in. He then suddenly ended his conversation and became soooo attentive! What a bunch of crap. Please do not waste your money at this hotel. It is not kept up, the carpeting is grey with dirt and all but the last room smelled terrible. It sure was a waste of my money, don't make it yours.

Reviews.Title: “Made the trip perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Los Angeles and we booked it all through Expedia. I was a little nervous booking a hotel like this, but we took our chances and regret nothing! It was easy to find, and close to everything we needed to be close to. The front desk was nice, the parking free and easy to access, and the room was great. It certainly isn't a 5 star resort, but it suited our needs. The free breakfast was better than you'd expect. There were two types of cereal, a whole lot of donuts, toast with jams to choose from, coffee, two types of juice - it was nice. We have no noise complaints and again, the service was fine. So if you need to stay in West Hollywood, or are just coming to LA for a fun trip, this place is affordable and doesn't have any problems that I noticed. Clean, comfortable and the room was spacious too.
